intro: Paliurus microcarpus, commonly known as the dwarf Chinese thornapple, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It belongs to the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its small, thorny branches and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically red when mature. It is adapted to dry, rocky soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
